Description: The Flight into Egypt. Night scene with the Virgin holding the sleeping Christ Child and riding on a donkey, Joseph besides them and peering back anxiously at two patrolling soldiers in the distance at left, an angel holding the reins attached to the donkeys' muzzle and leading, another angel hovering above and holding out a flaming torch to light the way; after Peter Paul Rubens Engraving
Producer name: Print made by: Marinus van der Goes
Curator's comments: For another impression see 1917,1208.533. After the preparatory drawing by Rubens in the BM (Gg,2.234; Hind 7; J. Rowlands, 'Rubens: Drawings and Sketches', British Museum ex. cat. 1977, nos. 170-1).
Bibliographic references: Hollstein / Dutch and Flemish etchings, engravings and woodcuts c.1450-1700 (4.II)
Schneevoogt 1873 / Catalogue des estampes gravées d'après P.P.Rubens (24.102)
Acquisition name: Bequeathed by: Clayton Mordaunt Cracherode (laid down and verso invisible, but mount stamped as Cracherode)
